original: @270a # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @270a # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: aasht' shta ke na tsa tu: sha shthi yo gi n'i ba lim bi dhi n'a ma /
analyzed: aasht' shta ke na tsa tu: sha shthi yo gi n'i ba lim bi dhi n'a ma /
translated: Aṣṭāṣṭakena caturṣaṣṭiyoginyabalividhināma

original: bod @270b skad du /
analyzed: bod @270b skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: brgyad brgyad drug cu rtsa bzhi'i rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi gtor ma'i cho ga zhes bya ba /
analyzed: brgyad brgyad drug cu rtsa bzhi'i rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi gtor ma'i cho ga zhes bya ba /
translated: The ritual of the bali offering to the yoginis of the sixty-four aṣṭāṣṭakas

original: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to glorious Vajrasattva.

original: sngags pas las tshogs sgrub pa dang / bar du gcod pa bsal par 'dod pas pho nya mo drug cu rtsa bzhi la dbyu gu drug cu rtsa bzhi'i gtor ma dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: sngags pas las tshogs sgrub pa dang / bar du gcod pa bsal par 'dod pas pho nya mo drug cu rtsa bzhi la dbyu gu drug cu rtsa bzhi'i gtor ma dbul bar bya'o //
translated: The mantrin who wishes to accomplish the collection of activities and to remove obstacles should offer the bali of the sixty-four praharas to the sixty-four messengers.

original: de la dang por skyabs su 'gro ba dang sems bskyed pa la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba'i chos mthun pa rnams byas te /
analyzed: de la dang por skyabs su 'gro ba dang sems bskyed pa la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba'i chos mthun pa rnams byas te /
translated: There, first, having performed the preliminaries, such as going for refuge and arousing the mind of awakening,

original: las dang rjes su mthun pa'i dkar gsum la sogs pa'i gtor ma'am /
analyzed: las dang rjes su mthun pa'i dkar gsum la sogs pa'i gtor ma'am /
translated: one should offer the bali of the three white foods, and so forth, which is in accordance with the activity,

original: bdud rtsi lnga dang bcas pa yongs su grags pa'i gnas brgyad dam /
analyzed: bdud rtsi lnga dang bcas pa yongs su grags pa'i gnas brgyad dam /
translated: together with the five nectars, in the eight famous places,

original: grong khyer la sogs pa'i phyogs brgyad dam /
analyzed: grong khyer la sogs pa'i phyogs brgyad dam /
translated: or in the eight directions of the city, and so forth.

original: yid dang mthun pa'i gnas rnams su mchod pa dang bcas pa'i gtor ma dbul bar bya ste /
analyzed: yid dang mthun pa'i gnas rnams su mchod pa dang bcas pa'i gtor ma dbul bar bya ste /
translated: In places agreeable to the mind, one should offer sacrificial cakes together with offerings.

original: de yang shar la sogs pa'i phyogs brgyad du ts'a rtsi k'a la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor ma brgyad brgyad drug cu rtsa bzhi po rnams dza: h'um bam ho:/
analyzed: de yang shar la sogs pa'i phyogs brgyad du ts'a rtsi k'a la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor ma brgyad brgyad drug cu rtsa bzhi po rnams dza: h'um bam ho:/
translated: Moreover, in the eight directions beginning with the east, one should invite the eight yoginis beginning with Cācini with JAH HUM VAM HOH, etc.

original: la sogs pas spyan drang ba la sogs pa bya ste /
analyzed: la sogs pas spyan drang ba la sogs pa bya ste /
translated: and perform the other rites.

original: de rnams kyang rang rang gi bzhon pa la gnas pa phyag bzhi pa spyan gsum pa zhal sna tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyang rang rang gi bzhon pa la gnas pa phyag bzhi pa spyan gsum pa zhal sna tshogs pa'o //
translated: They are all four-armed, three-eyed, and of various faces, standing on their respective vehicles.

original: de la shar gyi phyogs su padma 'dab ma brgyad pa'i ze'u 'bru la ts'a rtsi k'a zhal gcig pa nag mo'o //
analyzed: de la shar gyi phyogs su padma 'dab ma brgyad pa'i ze'u 'bru la ts'a rtsi k'a zhal gcig pa nag mo'o //
translated: In the east, on the pericarp of an eight-petaled lotus, is Cācini, who is black and has one face.

original: me'i mtshams su khyab 'jug ma nag mo'o //
analyzed: me'i mtshams su khyab 'jug ma nag mo'o //
translated: In the southeast is Visnu, who is black.

original: gshin rje dang bden bral du phag mo dang gdong drug ma dag dmar mo'o //🔽chu lhar dbang mo ser mo'o //
analyzed: gshin rje dang bden bral du phag mo dang gdong drug ma dag dmar mo'o // chu lhar dbang mo ser mo'o //
translated: In the south and southwest are Varahi and Sadbhuja, who are red.🔽In the west is Varuna, who is yellow.

original: rlung du rgya mtsho'i gdong ste tshangs ma ser mo'o //
analyzed: rlung du rgya mtsho'i gdong ste tshangs ma ser mo'o //
translated: In the northwest is Samudravasini, who is yellow.

original: byang du drag mo dkar mo'o //
analyzed: byang du drag mo dkar mo'o //
translated: In the north is white Rudravatī.

original: dbang ldan du dpal mo dkar mo ste de gnyis zhal gcig ma'o //
analyzed: dbang ldan du dpal mo dkar mo ste de gnyis zhal gcig ma'o //
translated: In the northeast is white Śrīmatī, both of whom have one face.

original: de ltar padma'i lte ba la gtso mo bzhugs pa'i brgyad brgyad drug cu rtsa bzhi'i pad 'dab la rnal 'byor ma rnams bzhugs pa ni rang rang gi gtso mo'i dbyibs dang kha dog la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de ltar padma'i lte ba la gtso mo bzhugs pa'i brgyad brgyad drug cu rtsa bzhi'i pad 'dab la rnal 'byor ma rnams bzhugs pa ni rang rang gi gtso mo'i dbyibs dang kha dog la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Thus, the yoginīs reside on the sixty-four lotus petals of the eight sets of eight in the center of the lotus, just like the shapes, colors, and so on of their respective principals.

original: da ni ts'a rtsi k'a la sogs pa rnams kyi rim pa bzhin du phyag g-yas kyi mtshan ma brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni ts'a rtsi k'a la sogs pa rnams kyi rim pa bzhin du phyag g-yas kyi mtshan ma brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the implements in the right hands of Caṇḍālī and so on will be described in order.

original: ts'a tsi k'a'i phyag g-yas kyi dang po ni gri gug / gnyis pan rtse gsum /
analyzed: ts'a tsi k'a'i phyag g-yas kyi dang po ni gri gug / gnyis pan rtse gsum /
translated: The first of Caṇḍālī’s right hands holds a flaying knife, the second a trident,

original: khyab 'jug ma'i 'khor lo dang dbyug to //🔽phag mo'i dbyug ba dang ral gri /
analyzed: khyab 'jug ma'i 'khor lo dang dbyug to // phag mo'i dbyug ba dang ral gri /
translated: Viṣṇumāyā’s a chakram and club,🔽Vārāhī’s a club and sword,

original: gzhon nu ma'i mdung thung dang lcags kyu /
analyzed: gzhon nu ma'i mdung thung dang lcags kyu /
translated: Kumārī’s a javelin and goad,

original: dbang mo'i rdo rje dang mda' //
analyzed: dbang mo'i rdo rje dang mda' //
translated: Indrāṇī’s a vajra and arrow,

original: tshangs ma'i padma dang tshangs pa'i dbyug pa /
analyzed: tshangs ma'i padma dang tshangs pa'i dbyug pa /
translated: Brahmī’s a lotus and brahminical staff,

original: drag mo'i rtsa gsum dang da ma ru /
analyzed: drag mo'i rtsa gsum dang da ma ru /
translated: Rudravatī’s a trident and ḍamaru,🔽and Śrīmatī’s a lotus and sword.

original: de ltar 'dab ma'i @271a * //
analyzed: de ltar 'dab ma'i @271a * //
translated: Thus, the goddesses of the petals.

original: lha mo rnams kyi g-yas kyi phyag gnyis pa rnams na yang ngo //
analyzed: lha mo rnams kyi g-yas kyi phyag gnyis pa rnams na yang ngo //
translated: In the second right hands of the goddesses are also.

original: da bzhin du ts'a rtsi ka'i phyag g-yon gyi dang po na thod pa /
analyzed: da bzhin du ts'a rtsi ka'i phyag g-yon gyi dang po na thod pa /
translated: Similarly, in the first left hand of Cācini is a skull,

original: gnyis pa na kha tv'am ga'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa na kha tv'am ga'o //
translated: in the second a khaṭvāṅga.

original: khyab 'jug ma'i padma dang mdung /
analyzed: khyab 'jug ma'i padma dang mdung /
translated: In Viṣṇumāyā are a lotus and a spear,

original: phag mo'i lcags sgrog dang phub /
analyzed: phag mo'i lcags sgrog dang phub /
translated: in Vārāhī iron fetters and a plow,

original: gzhon nu ma'i rin po che dang zhags pa /
analyzed: gzhon nu ma'i rin po che dang zhags pa /
translated: in Kumārī a jewel and a noose,

original: dbang mo'i dril bu dang gzhu /
analyzed: dbang mo'i dril bu dang gzhu /
translated: in Vaiṣṇavī a bell and a bow,

original: tshangs ma'i spyi blugs dang par bu /
analyzed: tshangs ma'i spyi blugs dang par bu /
translated: in Brahmāṇī a sacrificial ladle and a water jar,

original: drag mo'i kha tv'am ga dang sbrul /
analyzed: drag mo'i kha tv'am ga dang sbrul /
translated: in Rudrāṇī a khaṭvāṅga and a snake,

original: bkra shis chen mo'i padma dang rin po che rnams so //
analyzed: bkra shis chen mo'i padma dang rin po che rnams so //
translated: and in Mahālakṣmī a lotus and a jewel.

original: gtso mo ji lta ba bzhin du 'khor gyi lha mo rnams kyi yang ngo //
analyzed: gtso mo ji lta ba bzhin du 'khor gyi lha mo rnams kyi yang ngo //
translated: The retinue goddesses are like the principal goddess.

original: de la shar phyogs la sogs pa rnams su ts'a rtsi k'a la sogs pa rnams kyi padma'i 'dab ma rnams kyi mdun nas g-yas skor gyis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la shar phyogs la sogs pa rnams su ts'a rtsi k'a la sogs pa rnams kyi padma'i 'dab ma rnams kyi mdun nas g-yas skor gyis rig par bya'o //
translated: There, in the east and so on, beginning in front and turning to the right, Cācini and so on are on the lotus petals.

original: de la ts'a rtsi k'a la mngon par phyogs pa'i nor gyi padma'i 'dab ma rnams la 'dab ma dang por 'jigs byed ma'o //
analyzed: de la ts'a rtsi k'a la mngon par phyogs pa'i nor gyi padma'i 'dab ma rnams la 'dab ma dang por 'jigs byed ma'o //
translated: On the petals of the lotus of wealth that faces Caṇḍī, on the first petal is Bhairavī.

original: de bzhin du gnyis pa la sogs par drag mo dang / mche ba gnyis gtsigs ma dang / kha nas me 'bar ma dang / rlung shugs ma dang / rab gtum ma dang / drag mig ma dang / sna chen ma rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyis pa la sogs par drag mo dang / mche ba gnyis gtsigs ma dang / kha nas me 'bar ma dang / rlung shugs ma dang / rab gtum ma dang / drag mig ma dang / sna chen ma rnams so //
translated: Similarly, on the second petal and so on are Caṇḍī, Dveḍī, Jvālāmukhī, Vāyuvegā, Pracaṇḍā, Caṇḍākṣī, and Mahānāsā.

original: mer khyab 'jug ma la mngon par phyogs pa'i nor gyi padma'i 'dab ma rnams la /
analyzed: mer khyab 'jug ma la mngon par phyogs pa'i nor gyi padma'i 'dab ma rnams la /
translated: On the petals of the lotus of wealth that faces Viṣṇu,

original: khyab 'jug ma'i dang po la sogs par dpal mo dang / sgyu 'phrul ma dang / grags ma dang / bkra shis ma dang / shin tu nga rgyal ma dang / dpal rgyal ma dang / dpal can ma dang / 'khor lo can ma ste brgyad po rnams so //
analyzed: khyab 'jug ma'i dang po la sogs par dpal mo dang / sgyu 'phrul ma dang / grags ma dang / bkra shis ma dang / shin tu nga rgyal ma dang / dpal rgyal ma dang / dpal can ma dang / 'khor lo can ma ste brgyad po rnams so //
translated: on the first petal and so on are Śrī, Māyā, Yaśodharā, Maṅgalā, Mahāhiṃsā, Śrījayā, Śrīmati, and Cakrī.

original: lho ru phag mo'i padma'i 'dam ma la keng rus ma dang / dus mtshan ma dang / khro gdong ma dang / dus lce ma dang / gtsigs ma dang / nag mo dang / 'jigs byed ma dang / gzugs ngan ma ste brgyad rnams so //
analyzed: lho ru phag mo'i padma'i 'dam ma la keng rus ma dang / dus mtshan ma dang / khro gdong ma dang / dus lce ma dang / gtsigs ma dang / nag mo dang / 'jigs byed ma dang / gzugs ngan ma ste brgyad rnams so //
translated: In the south, on the lotus mud of Vārāhī, are Aśuci, Kālarātri, Krodhavadanā, Kālidāsī, Daṃṣṭrī, Kṛṣṇā, Bhīmakarī, and Durgarūpā.

original: bden bral du gzhon nu ma'i mdun gyi padma'i 'dab ma la /
analyzed: bden bral du gzhon nu ma'i mdun gyi padma'i 'dab ma la /
translated: In the southwest, on the lotus petals in front of Kumārī,

original: padma dang / yan lag med ma dang / gzhon nu ma dang / ri dags bdag mo dang / rin chen phreng ma dang / mig bzangs ma dang / rul pa ma dang / bzang mo ste brgyad po rnams so //
analyzed: padma dang / yan lag med ma dang / gzhon nu ma dang / ri dags bdag mo dang / rin chen phreng ma dang / mig bzangs ma dang / rul pa ma dang / bzang mo ste brgyad po rnams so //
translated: are Padmā, Anaṅgā, Kumārī, Mṛgajā, Ratnāvalī, Sulocana, Pūtikā, and Bhadrā.

original: nub tu dbang mo'i mdun gyi 'dab ma nas rdo rje 'od ma dang / rdo rje lus ma dang / gser gyi mchog ldan ma dang / rigs 'dzin ma dang / sna tshogs ri mo 'dri ma dang / chu shing ma dang / zug rdu sel ma dang /
analyzed: nub tu dbang mo'i mdun gyi 'dab ma nas rdo rje 'od ma dang / rdo rje lus ma dang / gser gyi mchog ldan ma dang / rigs 'dzin ma dang / sna tshogs ri mo 'dri ma dang / chu shing ma dang / zug rdu sel ma dang /
translated: In the west, on the lotus petals in front of Vaiśvānari, are Vajraprabhā, Vajradehā, Suvarṇottamā, Gotrabhṛt, Citrakarmā, Puṣkarā, Śalyahartā,

original: shin tu sgrol ma ste brgyad po rnams so //
analyzed: shin tu sgrol ma ste brgyad po rnams so //
translated: and Supāśā.🔽In the northwest, on the lotus petals in front of Caṇḍī, are

original: rlung du tshangs ma'i mdun gyi padma'i 'dab ma nas @271b mchog sbyin 'don ma dang / padma'i mig ma dang / chu skyes ldan ma dang / blo ma dang / ngag gi dbang phyug ma dang / glu len ma dang / glog ma dang / dran pa ma ste brgyad po rnams so //🔽byang du drag mo'i mdun gyi padma'i 'dab ma nas goo r'i dang / gam g'a dang / rtag ma dang / shin tu mgyogs ma dang / 'debs ma dang / dpal mo dang / ser skya dang / nag mo ste brgyad po rnams so //
analyzed: rlung du tshangs ma'i mdun gyi padma'i 'dab ma nas @271b mchog sbyin 'don ma dang / padma'i mig ma dang / chu skyes ldan ma dang / blo ma dang / ngag gi dbang phyug ma dang / glu len ma dang / glog ma dang / dran pa ma ste brgyad po rnams so // byang du drag mo'i mdun gyi padma'i 'dab ma nas goo r'i dang / gam g'a dang / rtag ma dang / shin tu mgyogs ma dang / 'debs ma dang / dpal mo dang / ser skya dang / nag mo ste brgyad po rnams so //
translated: In the wind direction, from the lotus petals in front of Brahma's wife, are Amoda, Padma-netra, Jalini, Mati, Vagisvari, Gitika, Visva, and Smriti.🔽In the north, from the lotus petals in front of Rudra's wife, are Gouri, Gaja, Nitya, Ati-java, Kshanti, Sri, Pishima, and Krishna.

original: dbang ldan du bkra shis chen mo'i mdun gyi padma'i 'dab ma la dpal ldan dkar mo dang / zla ba'i ri mo can dang / ri bong 'dzin zhal ma dang / dang pa'i mdog can dang / 'dzin byed ma dang / padma'i dbang phyug ma dang /
analyzed: dbang ldan du bkra shis chen mo'i mdun gyi padma'i 'dab ma la dpal ldan dkar mo dang / zla ba'i ri mo can dang / ri bong 'dzin zhal ma dang / dang pa'i mdog can dang / 'dzin byed ma dang / padma'i dbang phyug ma dang /
translated: In the northeast, on the lotus petals in front of Maha-mangala, are Sri-prabha, Candra-bhuja, Sasin-mukhi, Prasanna-varna, Grahi, Padma-pati,

original: 'od zer mig ma dang / dri med ri bong 'dzin ma rnams te brgyad brgyad drug cu rtsa bzhi po rnams so //🔽padma'i lte pa la ts'a mu nd'a'i gdan la yi dags dmar po'o //
analyzed: 'od zer mig ma dang / dri med ri bong 'dzin ma rnams te brgyad brgyad drug cu rtsa bzhi po rnams so // padma'i lte pa la ts'a mu nd'a'i gdan la yi dags dmar po'o //
translated: The eight are: the eye ray, the stainless rabbit-holder.🔽On the pericarp of the lotus, on a seat of campaka flowers, is a red hungry ghost.🔽

original: 'dab ma la lha mo brgyad do //🔽khyab 'jug ma'i bya khung ngo //🔽phag mo'i ma he'o //🔽gzhon nu ma'i rma bya'o //
analyzed: 'dab ma la lha mo brgyad do // khyab 'jug ma'i bya khung ngo // phag mo'i ma he'o // gzhon nu ma'i rma bya'o //
translated: The eight goddesses are:🔽Vajra-Vārāhī,🔽Vajra-Cāmuṇḍā,

original: dbang mo'i glang po che'o //🔽tshangs ma'i ngang pa'o //🔽drag mo'i glang ngo //🔽bkra shis chen mo'i seng ge'o //🔽ts'a rtsi k'a la sogs pa'i sa bon gyi yi ge ni ha yig ni ts'a mund'i'o //🔽ham yig ni dbang phyug chen mo'o //🔽ha na phag mo'i'o //
analyzed: dbang mo'i glang po che'o // tshangs ma'i ngang pa'o // drag mo'i glang ngo // bkra shis chen mo'i seng ge'o // ts'a rtsi k'a la sogs pa'i sa bon gyi yi ge ni ha yig ni ts'a mund'i'o // ham yig ni dbang phyug chen mo'o // ha na phag mo'i'o //
translated: Vajra-Vāyuvegā,

original: h'a ni dbang mo'i'o //🔽ksha ni khyab 'jug chen mo'i'o //🔽ksh'a ni tshangs ma'i'o //🔽ksham ni bkra shis chen mo'i'o //🔽ksha ni gzhon nu ma'i ste gtso bo rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: h'a ni dbang mo'i'o //🔽ksha ni khyab 'jug chen mo'i'o //🔽ksh'a ni tshangs ma'i'o //🔽ksham ni bkra shis chen mo'i'o //🔽ksha ni gzhon nu ma'i ste gtso bo rnams kyi'o //
translated: Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-Vajra-V

original: de bzhin du 'dab ma'i lha mo rnams kyi rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du shar la sogs pa'i phyogs brjod kyi rgyab kyi padma'i 'dab ma rnams la h'i hr'i h'u hl'i ksh'i kshr'i ksh'u kshl'i /🔽zhes bya ba'i dbyangs ring po rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dab ma'i lha mo rnams kyi rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du shar la sogs pa'i phyogs brjod kyi rgyab kyi padma'i 'dab ma rnams la h'i hr'i h'u hl'i ksh'i kshr'i ksh'u kshl'i / zhes bya ba'i dbyangs ring po rnams so //
translated: Likewise, the long vowels are on the lotus petals of the goddesses in the east and so on, in the same order as the directions.

original: mdun gyi phyogs kyi 'dab ma brgyad rnams la hi hri hu hli kshi kshi kshu kshli /🔽zhes bya ba'i dbyangs yig thung du rnams so //🔽shar gyi padma'i 'dab ma dag dang / lho'i dag dang / byang gi dag dang / nub kyi ngag dang / me'i ngag dang / bden bral gyi dag dang / dbang ldan gyi ngag dang / rlung gi dag tu'o //🔽lhag ma'i 'dab ma drug la ya sogs dbyangs drug dbye ba pad 'dab drug nyid rim pas yongs su byas par thung rang ring pa dang / zhes ba bya la /
analyzed: mdun gyi phyogs kyi 'dab ma brgyad rnams la hi hri hu hli kshi kshi kshu kshli /🔽zhes bya ba'i dbyangs yig thung du rnams so //🔽shar gyi padma'i 'dab ma dag dang / lho'i dag dang / byang gi dag dang / nub kyi ngag dang / me'i ngag dang / bden bral gyi dag dang / dbang ldan gyi ngag dang / rlung gi dag tu'o //🔽lhag ma'i 'dab ma drug la ya sogs dbyangs drug dbye ba pad 'dab drug nyid rim pas yongs su byas par thung rang ring pa dang / zhes ba bya la /

original: phyogs mtshams kyi padma'i 'dab ma rnams su ste //
analyzed: phyogs mtshams kyi padma'i 'dab ma rnams su ste //
translated: On the petals of the lotuses in the directions and quarters.

original: de la ts'a mund'i padma'i 'dab mar sngar bkod pa'i hi yig go //
analyzed: de la ts'a mund'i padma'i 'dab mar sngar bkod pa'i hi yig go //
translated: There, on the petal of the Cāmuṇḍā lotus, is the previously placed letter ha.

original: de nas g-yon skor gyis 'dab ma @272a * //
analyzed: de nas g-yon skor gyis 'dab ma @272a * //
translated: Then, proceeding counterclockwise,

original: gnyis par ya'o //
analyzed: gnyis par ya'o //
translated: on the second petal is ya.

original: gsum par yi'o //
analyzed: gsum par yi'o //
translated: On the third is i.

original: bzhi par yri'o //
analyzed: bzhi par yri'o //
translated: On the fourth is ri.

original: lnga par sngar bkod pa'i h'i'o //
analyzed: lnga par sngar bkod pa'i h'i'o //
translated: On the fifth is the previously placed ha.

original: drug par yu'o //
analyzed: drug par yu'o //
translated: On the sixth is u.

original: bdun par y'i'o //
analyzed: bdun par y'i'o //
translated: On the seventh is i.

original: brgyad par yam ngo //
analyzed: brgyad par yam ngo //
translated: On the eighth is m.

original: de bzhin du khyab 'jug ma'i kshi y'a y'i yr'i ksh'i y'u yl'i ya /
analyzed: de bzhin du khyab 'jug ma'i kshi y'a y'i yr'i ksh'i y'u yl'i ya /
translated: Similarly, for Viṣṇu's wife, the letters kṣa, yā, yī, yṛ, kṣa, yū, yl, and y are placed.

original: de bzhin du phag mo'i mdun gyi 'dab ma hri'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du phag mo'i mdun gyi 'dab ma hri'o //
translated: Similarly, for Vārāhī, the petal in front is hrī.

original: de bzhin du ra ri hli ru rli ra rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du ra ri hli ru rli ra rnams so //
translated: Similarly, the letters ra, ri, li, ru, rli, and ra are placed.

original: de bzhin du gzhon nu ma'i kshri r'a r'i rr'i kshi r'u rl'i ra rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhon nu ma'i kshri r'a r'i rr'i kshi r'u rl'i ra rnams so //
translated: Similarly, for Kumārī, the letters kṣa, rā, rī, rṛ, kṣa, rū, rli, and ra are placed.

original: de bzhin du drag mo'i hu wa wi wri hu wu wli wam rnam so //
analyzed: de bzhin du drag mo'i hu wa wi wri hu wu wli wam rnam so //
translated: Similarly, for Caṇḍī, the letters hu, va, vī, vṛ, hu, vū, vli, and vam are placed.

original: de bzhin du bkra shis chen po'i kshu w'a w'i wr'i ksh'u w'u wl'i wa rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du bkra shis chen po'i kshu w'a w'i wr'i ksh'u w'u wl'i wa rnams so //
translated: Similarly, for Mahāmaṅgalā, the letters kṣa, vā, vī, vṛ, kṣa, vū, vli, and va are placed.

original: de bzhin du dbang mo'i hli la li lri hl'i lu wam lam rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang mo'i hli la li lri hl'i lu wam lam rnams so //
translated: Likewise, the vowels of the organ of speech are h li li li h la lu va la ma.

original: de bzhin du tshangs ma'i kshl'a l'a l'i lr'i kshl'i l'u ll'i la zhes pa rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshangs ma'i kshl'a l'a l'i lr'i kshl'i l'u ll'i la zhes pa rnams so //
translated: Likewise, the vowels of Brahmā are kṣa la la la kṣa la lu la la.

original: de rnams las lha rnams rdzogs par bskyed nas /
analyzed: de rnams las lha rnams rdzogs par bskyed nas /
translated: Having generated the complete deities from those,

original: de nas bz'a ba dang bca' ba la sogs pa'i gtor ma rgyas par bshams te /
analyzed: de nas bz'a ba dang bca' ba la sogs pa'i gtor ma rgyas par bshams te /
translated: then one should arrange the extensive offerings of food, drink, and so on.

original: yam ram wam lam /
analyzed: yam ram wam lam /
translated: Yam ram vam lam

original: aa aa aa /
analyzed: aa aa aa /
translated: A ā ā🔽

original: bir shu ma mu /
analyzed: bir shu ma mu /
translated: vir śu mu

original: aa ai ri au li //
analyzed: aa ai ri au li //
translated: a ai ri ou li

original: na gu ha go te /
analyzed: na gu ha go te /
translated: na gu ha go te🔽ā ī ri ūr li

original: a'a a'i r'i a'u l'i zhes pa'i sa bon gyi yi ge rnams las 'byung pa rim brtsegs dang bdud rtsi lnga la sogs par bskyed nas rnams par sbyang pa'i sngags ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: a'a a'i r'i a'u l'i zhes pa'i sa bon gyi yi ge rnams las 'byung pa rim brtsegs dang bdud rtsi lnga la sogs par bskyed nas rnams par sbyang pa'i sngags ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Having generated the stacked-up seat and the five elixirs, and so on, from the seed syllables, the mantra of purification is as follows:

original: aom aom badzra tsandra sarba dharmma: su bi shuddha sv'a bh'a ba sarba dha rmm'a: su bi shuddha sva bh'a ba sarba rmma na bi sho dha nya h'a /
analyzed: aom aom badzra tsandra sarba dharmma: su bi shuddha sv'a bh'a ba sarba dha rmm'a: su bi shuddha sva bh'a ba sarba rmma na bi sho dha nya h'a /
translated: oṃ oṃ vajra candra sarva dharma suviśuddha svabhāva sarva dharma suviśuddha svabhāva sarva karma-āvaraṇa viśodhani hā.

original: aom a'a: badzra s'u rya sarba dharmm'a: pra bo dha ka sarba dharmma na pra bo dha ya sv'a h'a //🔽aom h'um badzra aa na la sarba dharmma: pra d'i pa ka sarba dharmma: pra d'i pa ya sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom a'a: badzra s'u rya sarba dharmm'a: pra bo dha ka sarba dharmma na pra bo dha ya sv'a h'a // aom h'um badzra aa na la sarba dharmma: pra d'i pa ka sarba dharmma: pra d'i pa ya sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ āḥ vajra-sūrya sarva-dharmāḥ prabodhakāḥ sarva-dharmāṇi prabodhaya svāhā.🔽Oṃ hūṃ vajra-anala sarva-dharmāḥ pradīpakāḥ sarva-dharmāṇi pradīpaya svāhā.

original: aom ho / sarba dharmma badzra aa mri ta k'a ra sarba dharmma na badzra aa mri tam ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom ho / sarba dharmma badzra aa mri ta k'a ra sarba dharmma na badzra aa mri tam ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ hoḥ sarva-dharmā vajra-amṛta-kāra sarva-dharmāṇi vajra-amṛtaṃ kuru kuru svāhā.

original: sngags kyi rigs 'di rnams kyi go rims ji lta ba bzhin du lag pa g-yon pas sbyang par bya ba dang / g-yas pas rtog par bya ba dag reg pas so //
analyzed: sngags kyi rigs 'di rnams kyi go rims ji lta ba bzhin du lag pa g-yon pas sbyang par bya ba dang / g-yas pas rtog par bya ba dag reg pas so //
translated: By touching with the left hand, one should purify, and with the right hand, one should imagine, these mantra-families in the proper order.

original: 'og tu snyim pa kha sbub pas bkab ste rab tu sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'og tu snyim pa kha sbub pas bkab ste rab tu sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should cover with the cupped hands turned downward and apply.

original: rdo rje bya khyung gi phyag rgyas rdo rje bdud rtsir byas te /
analyzed: rdo rje bya khyung gi phyag rgyas rdo rje bdud rtsir byas te /
translated: With the mudrā of the vajra garuḍa, one should make the vajra nectar.

original: de nas rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma rnams spyan drang bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma rnams spyan drang bar bya ste /
translated: Then one should summon the vajra dakinis.

original: aom ha h'a hi h'i badzra bhee ra ba a'a karsha ya a'a ka rsha ya /
analyzed: aom ha h'a hi h'i badzra bhee ra ba a'a karsha ya a'a ka rsha ya /
translated: Oṃ ha hā hī hūṃ vajra-bhīru ākarṣaya ākarṣaya.

original: pra nge sha ya pra be sha ya /
analyzed: pra nge sha ya pra be sha ya /
translated: praṇaya praveśaya

original: bandha ya bandha ya /
analyzed: bandha ya bandha ya /
translated: bandhaya bandhaya

original: to sha ya to sha ya /
analyzed: to sha ya to sha ya /
translated: toṣaya toṣaya

original: dza: h'um bam ho: badzra d'a ki n'i n'am hri da yam hum h'um phrem phrem phat /
analyzed: dza: h'um bam ho: badzra d'a ki n'i n'am hri da yam hum h'um phrem phrem phat /
translated: jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ vajra-ḍākinī-nāṃ hṛdayaṃ huṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ

original: ces pa'i sngags kyis spyan drang ngo //
analyzed: ces pa'i sngags kyis spyan drang ngo //
translated: With this mantra, invite.

original: de nas rdo rje rtse lnga pa'i phyag rgyas mkha' 'gro ma rnams la gtor ma dri dang / me tog dang / spos dang / mar me dang / mchod yon dang / rdzas ma nyams pa dang bcas pa rnams dbul par bya /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje rtse lnga pa'i phyag rgyas mkha' 'gro ma rnams la gtor ma dri dang / me tog dang / spos dang / mar me dang / mchod yon dang / rdzas ma nyams pa dang bcas pa rnams dbul par bya /
translated: Then, with the five-tined vajra mudra, offer the torma to the dakinis, along with scent, flowers, incense, lamps, water for welcoming, and undamaged substances.

original: aom a'a: h'um ho: badzra tsa rtsi k'a bh'i mo gr'a /
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um ho: badzra tsa rtsi k'a bh'i mo gr'a /
translated: oṃ āḥ hūṃ hoḥ vajra-ca(r) tsi(r) kā🔽bhim(o) gharā

original: k'a la dam shda /
analyzed: k'a la dam shda /
translated: kāla-damṣṭrā

original: dzva la da na la mu kh'a /
analyzed: dzva la da na la mu kh'a /
translated: jvalad-anala-mukhi

original: @272b b'a yu be g'a /
analyzed: @272b b'a yu be g'a /
translated: vāyu-vega

original: pra tsanda roo dr'a ksh'i /
analyzed: pra tsanda roo dr'a ksh'i /
translated: pracaṇḍa-roṣa-rakṣi

original: sth'u la n'a s'a bh'a: sa pa ri w'a re bhya /
analyzed: sth'u la n'a s'a bh'a: sa pa ri w'a re bhya /
translated: sthūla-nāsā-bhaḥ saparivāra-bhyaḥ

original: ae dam ba lim gandham pu shpam dh'u pam d'i pam aaksha tam da d'a ma he te tsa a'a ba tya sa pa ri w'a re: sh'i ghram ai dam ba lim gri hna ntu kh'a da ntu /
analyzed: ae dam ba lim gandham pu shpam dh'u pam d'i pam aaksha tam da d'a ma he te tsa a'a ba tya sa pa ri w'a re: sh'i ghram ai dam ba lim gri hna ntu kh'a da ntu /
translated: Aiddha balim gandham puṣpam dhūpam dīpam akṣatam dadhyānnaṃ mahe te cāvaṭyā saparivāre śṛṅga idam balim gṛhṇantu khādantaḥ pibantaḥ /

original: bi bantu dza: h'um bam ho:/🔽sam tri pt'a: sarba tv'a n'am sh'a nti pu shti ra ksh'a ba ra /
analyzed: bi bantu dza: h'um bam ho:/ sam tri pt'a: sarba tv'a n'am sh'a nti pu shti ra ksh'a ba ra /
translated: vibanti jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ /🔽 santarpitāḥ sarvatvānāṃ śānti-puṣṭi-rakṣāvaraṇaguptaṃ kurvantu hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ /

original: gum ptam ku rbantu hum h'um phat badzra dha ra a'a dzny'a pa ya ti sv'a h'a /
analyzed: gum ptam ku rbantu hum h'um phat badzra dha ra a'a dzny'a pa ya ti sv'a h'a /
translated: vajradhara ājñāpayati svāhā /

original: zhes bya bas ts'a rtsi k'a 'khor dang bcas pa la gtor ma dbul lo //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ts'a rtsi k'a 'khor dang bcas pa la gtor ma dbul lo //
translated: With this, offer the bali to Cācini and her retinue.

original: sa ba ri w'a ra zhes bya ba nas sv'a h'a'i bar gyis gzhan rnams la yang rang ming dang bcas pas dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: sa ba ri w'a ra zhes bya ba nas sv'a h'a'i bar gyis gzhan rnams la yang rang ming dang bcas pas dbul bar bya'o //
translated: With sabarivara up to svāhā, offer to the others as well, each with their own name.🔽 Oṃ āḥ hūṃ hoḥ /

original: aom a'a: hum ho: badzra beeshnu bi shri: m'a y'a /
analyzed: aom a'a: hum ho: badzra beeshnu bi shri: m'a y'a /
translated: vajravaiśravaṇa viśruti māyā /🔽 keśarati /

original: k'i rt'i / la kshmya /
analyzed: k'i rt'i / la kshmya /
translated: lakṣmī /

original: su pa ra ma /
analyzed: su pa ra ma /
translated: suvarma /

original: bi dza y'a /🔽shr'i dza ya na t'i /
analyzed: bi dza y'a / shr'i dza ya na t'i /
translated: vijaya /🔽 śrījayantī /

original: shr'i tsa kri bhya:/
analyzed: shr'i tsa kri bhya:/
translated: śrīcakrī bhyāḥ /🔽

original: zhes bya bas khyab 'jug ma 'khor dang bcas pa la 'bul lo //
analyzed: zhes bya bas khyab 'jug ma 'khor dang bcas pa la 'bul lo //
translated: With this, offer to Viṣṇu and his retinue.

original: aom a'a: hum ho:/
analyzed: aom a'a: hum ho:/
translated: Oṃ āḥ hūṃ hoḥ.

original: badzra b'a r'a h'i /
analyzed: badzra b'a r'a h'i /

analyzed: kam k'a l'i /

analyzed: k'a la r'a tr'i /

analyzed: pra ku bi ti pa d'a n'a / k'a la dzi hv'a /
translated: Prakupitapādāntā.🔽Kālajighran.

original: k'a r'a l'am /
analyzed: k'a r'a l'am /
translated: Kālarātri.🔽Kāli.

original: k'a l'i / gho r'a /
analyzed: k'a l'i / gho r'a /
translated: Ghorā.

original: bi r'u pa bhya:/
analyzed: bi r'u pa bhya:/

analyzed: zhes bya bas rdo rje phag mo 'khor dang bcas pa la dbul lo //
translated: With this, offer to Vajravārāhī and her retinue.

original: aom a'a: hum ho: badzra ku m'a r'i /
analyzed: aom a'a: hum ho: badzra ku m'a r'i /
translated: Oṃ āḥ hūṃ hoḥ. Vajrakumārī.🔽Padmā.

analyzed: padm'a / aa nam g'a /

original: ku m'a r'i /
analyzed: ku m'a r'i /

original: mri ga pa ti ga ma n'a /
analyzed: mri ga pa ti ga ma n'a /
translated: Mṛgapaṭṭigāminī.

original: ratna m'a l'a /
analyzed: ratna m'a l'a /

analyzed: su ne tr'a /
translated: Sunetrā.🔽Kālinī.

original: kl'i nan / bha dr'a bhya:/

analyzed: aom a'a: hum ho: badzra aindri /

analyzed: badzr'a bh'a / badzra g'a tr'a / wa rka na ka ba t'i /

analyzed: tso ra ba s'i /

original: tsi tra le kh'a /
analyzed: tsi tra le kh'a /

analyzed: padma ne tr'a /

analyzed: kha lu dza la dza bi t'i /

analyzed: smri ti bhya:/ zhes bya bas tshangs ma 'khor dang bcas pa la dbul lo //

analyzed: aom a'a: hum ho: badzra ma he shva r'i /

analyzed: goo r'i / gam g'a /

analyzed: na ni ty'a /
translated: nandiṭṭhā

analyzed: su pa ra ma tu ri t'a /
translated: suparamaduritā

original: to ta l'a /
analyzed: to ta l'a /
translated: toṭalā🔽lakṣmaṇā

analyzed: lakshma n'a / pim ga l'a /
translated: piṅgalā🔽kṛṣṇābhyaḥ.

analyzed: krishn'a bhya:/ zhes bya bas drag mo 'khor dang bcas pa la dbul lo //
translated: With this, offer to Rudrāṇī and her retinue.

original: aom a'a: hum ho:/
analyzed: aom a'a: hum ho:/
translated: Oṃ āḥ hūṃ hoḥ

original: ma h'a la kshm'a /
analyzed: ma h'a la kshm'a /
translated: mahālakṣmī

original: shr'e shve t'a /
analyzed: shr'e shve t'a /
translated: śvetā

original: tsandra le kh'a /🔽sha sh'a dha ra ba d'a n'a /
analyzed: tsandra le kh'a / sha sh'a dha ra ba d'a n'a /
translated: candralekhā🔽śaśāṅkadatā

original: ham sa ba ra n'a /
analyzed: ham sa ba ra n'a /
translated: haṃsavāhanā🔽dhṛti

original: dhri ti / padme shva /
analyzed: dhri ti / padme shva /
translated: padmeśvarā

original: t'a r'a ne tr'a /🔽bi ma la sha sh'a dha r'a bhya:/
analyzed: t'a r'a ne tr'a / bi ma la sha sh'a dha r'a bhya:/
translated: tārānetre🔽vimalaśaśāṅkadharābhyaḥ.

original: zhes bya bas bkra shis chen mo 'khor dang bcas pa rnams la gtor ma dbul par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bas bkra shis chen mo 'khor dang bcas pa rnams la gtor ma dbul par bya'o //
translated: With this, offer the bali to Mahāmaṅgalā and her retinue.

original: sa pa ri w'a re zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas sv'a h'a'i bar du sde tshan re re zhing yang shes par bya'o //🔽dbyu gu drug cu rtsa bzhi yi //
analyzed: sa pa ri w'a re zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas sv'a h'a'i bar du sde tshan re re zhing yang shes par bya'o // dbyu gu drug cu rtsa bzhi yi //
translated: One should know the group of the syllables beginning with saparivāra up to svāhā.🔽The sixty-four yoginīs

original: gtor ma drug cu rtsa bzhi yis //
analyzed: gtor ma drug cu rtsa bzhi yis //
translated: are to be worshipped with sixty-four bali offerings🔽by the mantrin who knows the outer and inner dharmas,

original: sa stengs gnas na pho nya rnams //🔽@273a * // mchod byas dgos 'dong sgrub par byed //
analyzed: sa stengs gnas na pho nya rnams // @273a * // mchod byas dgos 'dong sgrub par byed //
translated: and who is established on the earth.

original: phyi dang nang gi chos shes pa'i sngags pas rnal 'byor ma'i tshogs rnams mchod cing mnyes par byas /
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi chos shes pa'i sngags pas rnal 'byor ma'i tshogs rnams mchod cing mnyes par byas /
translated: The mantrin who knows the outer and inner dharmas should worship and please the hosts of yoginīs,

original: mchog dang thun mong gi dngos grub tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mchog dang thun mong gi dngos grub tu 'gyur ro //
translated: and [he] will attain the supreme and common siddhis.

original: dpal dus kyi 'khor lo las rnal 'byor ma drug cu rtsa bzhi'i gtor ma'i cho ga bsdus pa ;
analyzed: dpal dus kyi 'khor lo las rnal 'byor ma drug cu rtsa bzhi'i gtor ma'i cho ga bsdus pa ;
translated: The concise bali ritual of the sixty-four yoginīs from the glorious Kālacakra

original: rnal 'byor ma drug cu rtsa bzhi dbyu gu drug cu rtsa bzhi'i gtor ma'i cho ga rdzogs so /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma drug cu rtsa bzhi dbyu gu drug cu rtsa bzhi'i gtor ma'i cho ga rdzogs so /
translated: The bali ritual of the sixty-four yoginīs in sixty-four mātrās is complete.

original: // / pandi ta chen po k'i rti tsandra'i zhal snga nas /
analyzed: // / pandi ta chen po k'i rti tsandra'i zhal snga nas /
translated: By the great paṇḍita Kīrticandra

original: lo ts'a ba grags pa rgyal mtshan gyis bsgyur ro//
analyzed: lo ts'a ba grags pa rgyal mtshan gyis bsgyur ro//
translated: and the translator Drakpa Gyaltsen.
